meanings.def: a building or set of buildings at an airport where passengers arrive and leave
examples: A second terminal was opened last year.

meanings.def: a place, building or set of buildings where journeys by train, bus or boat begin or end
examples: The new high-speed train will stop at a terminal to be built at Kings Cross station.
They intend to build a massive new rail terminal.
When I woke up I was in the bus terminal.

meanings.def: a piece of equipment, usually consisting of a keyboard and a screen that joins the user to a central computer system
examples: Internet terminals have been installed at most libraries.
All she did was press a few keys on the terminal.
The larger financial institutions have over 200 news and data terminals in their offices.
There were two students at each terminal.

meanings.def: a point at which connections can be made in an electric circuit
that cannot be cured and will lead to death, often slowly
examples: (figurative) She's suffering from terminal (= very great) boredom.

meanings.def: suffering from an illness that cannot be cured and will lead to death
certain to get worse and come to an end
examples: The industry is in terminal decline.
a terminal branch of a tree
terminal examinations (= at the end of a course, etc.)
